page.title: 04Yarm Churches
page.content:
There are four churches in Yarm.
(1) {Yarm Parish Church} (St Mary Magdalene.) The original Saxon Church was rebuilt in stone in the 12th cent but a fire in the 18th cent.destroyed much of the Norman building. (2) {Yarm Methodist Chapel}This is an unusual octagonal building from the 18th cent.and described by John Wesley as "the most elegant in all England." (3) {Yarm Catholic Church} (St Mary and St Romuald) This was built and equipped by Thomas Meynell of the Friarage.Altar made of Caen stone. (4) {Emmanuel Chapel}A recently established church using the old infant school building in West St. A 'daughter' church of Stockton Baptist Tabernacle
